content: the stranded colourwork chart a chart key pattern as follows rnds 1-5 work chart a for the appropriate row a total of 16 18 20 times in each round round 6 k1 with cc2 and slip the stitch to needle 2 this is the new bor with cc2 knit to the end of the round rnds 7-16 in each round work chart b sts 1-8 for the appropriate row a total of 7 8 9 chart b times then work sts 9-17 once round 17 work chart b sts 1-8 for row 17 a total of 7 8 9 times then work sts 9-16 once rnds 18-27 in each round work chart b sts 1-8 for the appropriate row a total of 8 9 10 times round 28 with cc2 knit until 1 st remains place a temporary bor marker for the next 5 rnds rnds 29-33 starting at the temporary bor work chart a for the appropriate row a total of 16 18 20 times in each round finally remove the temporary bor marker and k1 with cc1 cut cc1 and cc2 and attach mc switch back to smaller needles if desired and knit two rnds with mc finally work p1 k3 ribbing for 12 14 16 rnds or to desired leg length armo socks page 2/4 heel flap redistribute sts as follows the first 33 37 41 work the established ribbing on needle 1 sts of the round on needle 1 and the last 31 35 work the gusset decreases on needle 2 as 39 sts of the round on needle 2 the heel flap is follows worked back and forth on needle 2 starting round 1 ssk knit until 2 sts remain k2tog on the ws as follows round 2 knit row 1 ws sl1 p30 p34 p38 turn repeat rnds 1 and 2 until 31 35 39 sts row 2 rs *sl1 k1* repeat * - * until 1 st remain on needle 2 remains k1 turn repeat row 1 and 2 until there are 30 34 foot 38 row in total in the heel flap or to desired length and you have just finished row 2 work the established ribbing on needle 1 and knit the sts on needle 2 until foot measures approximately 5 5 6 6 5 cm / 2⅛ 2⅜ 2⅝ inches less than the desired final length heel turn next round knit until 1 st remains on needle 2 work the heel turn starting on the ws as place a temporary bor marker this is a follows temporary bor for the next five rnds row 1 ws sl1 p17 p19 p21 p2tog p1 attach cc1 and cc2 switch to larger needles turn if preferred starting at the temporary bor row 2 rs sl1 k6 ssk k1 turn marker work chart a 16 18 20 times in each row 3 ws sl1 purl until 1 st remains before round finally remove the temporary bor the gap p2tog p1 turn marker and k1
